meanings.definition: A gene that is present in only a few copies in a genome.
meanings.sent1: The oligogene played a crucial role in the genetic makeup of the organism.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the oligogene to understand its unique function in the genome.
meanings.sent3: The oligogene decided to throw a party for the other genes in the genome.
meanings.sent4: Like a rare gem, the oligogene shone brightly among the common genes.
meanings.sent5: In the vast genome, the oligogene stood out like a tiny treasure waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an oligogene.
meanings.sent1: The oligogene trait was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: Her oligogene features made her stand out in the family.
meanings.sent3: The party had an oligogene theme, with unique decorations and activities.
meanings.sent4: His intelligence was like an oligogene, rare and valuable.
meanings.sent5: The oligogene characteristic made her different from everyone else.

meanings.definition: To oligogenize: to introduce or incorporate an oligogene into a genome.
meanings.sent1: Scientists oligogenized the genome to study the effects of the new gene.
meanings.sent2: She decided to oligogenize the organism to enhance its genetic diversity.
meanings.sent3: The researchers oligogenized the genome, creating a buzz in the scientific community.
meanings.sent4: He hoped to oligogenize the genome and unlock new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The process of oligogenizing the genome required precision and expertise.
